author: Volker

comments.message: Intriguing idea - it can certainly be difficult to remember such things, especially when facing the stress that you might be infected. How do you see this being rolled out? What behavior change promotion would need to accompany this? Would people be interested/willing/able (literacy rates?) to use this? How would health workers make use of this tool?

Absolutely, let's not reinvent the wheel, there must be tons of kits. Concerning promotion of such a thing - I'd almost say, that communities/municipalities need to step in. This is not a problem of West Africa but also one of Madrid, Hamburg or Dallas. Why not send a map to every household? This needs to be a large scale and thorough initiative.

description:
This day by day listing of activities and people met is meant to help identify others being at risk of being infected.

The map could be a lo-fi print out or an app.
summary: A visual map helps affected patients to trace back the last two or so weeks up until today.
title: Retrace your steps
